Load R object from file

Source: R/utils.R
load_object.Rd

Loads an R object from a file with error handling.

Usage

load_object(file_path)

Arguments

file_path

Character string specifying the file path.

Value

The loaded R object.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Checks if the file exists

  2. Loads the object using readRDS()

  3. Handles errors with informative messages

This function is useful for:

  • Loading saved Seurat objects

  • Loading analysis results

  • Loading intermediate data

The function ensures:

  • The file exists before loading

  • Errors are caught and reported

  • The loaded object is returned

See also

readRDS for the base R function save_object for saving objects

Examples

seurat_object <- load_object("./results/seurat_object.rds")
#> Error in load_object("./results/seurat_object.rds"): File not found: ./results/seurat_object.rds
